com.xith3d.scenegraph
Class PointSound

java.lang.Object
  com.xith3d.scenegraph.SceneGraphObject
      com.xith3d.scenegraph.Node
          com.xith3d.scenegraph.Leaf
              com.xith3d.scenegraph.Sound
                  com.xith3d.scenegraph.PointSound
public class PointSound
extends Sound

Point sounds are those sounds which exist in the point in space within the transform groups it exists. It is assumed that the sound exists within its local coordinate system at 0,0,0

Point sounds have thier volume attenuated based on an inverse distance formula which is accustically similar to that of the human ear. This is not linear, but rather logarithmic in nature.

Originally Coded by David Yazel on Sep 12, 2003 at 10:21:16 PM.

setMaxDistance

public void setMaxDistance(float maxDistance)
Sets the max distance before the sound is a min volume. If this is set to -1 then the View's sound activation radius will be used.

getRolloffFactor

public float getRolloffFactor()
Compresses or expands the range this sound can be heard. 0 will make the sound unattenuated (unefected by distance). 1 is the normal setting. 0.5 will make the sound appear to be twice as close as it really is, while 2 will make it sound twice as far away as it really is.

Returns:

setRolloffFactor

public void setRolloffFactor(float rolloffFactor)
Compresses or expands the range this sound can be heard. 0 will make the sound unattenuated (unefected by distance). 1 is the normal setting. 0.5 will make the sound appear to be twice as close as it really is, while 2 will make it sound twice as far away as it really is.

Returns:

getReferenceDistance

public float getReferenceDistance()
The reference distance is the distance from the view that the sound will become at maximum volume. This is usually good to set within a few units of the view so that you don't have scaling in the last few units.

Returns:

setReferenceDistance

public void setReferenceDistance(float referenceDistance)
The reference distance is the distance from the view that the sound will become at maximum volume. This is usually good to set within a few units of the view so that you don't have scaling in the last few units. If the reference distance is -1 then the 0.17 of the max distance will be used.

Returns:
